President of the Inter-American Development Bank 1988-2005
In 1988 Enrique Iglesias was appointed President of the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), a post he held for 17 years until 2005.
He held the post of President of the Central Bank of Uruguay from 1966 until 1988
between 1975 and 1985, the Executive Secretary of the UN Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean
in 1981, the Secretary General of the UN Conference on New and Renewable Sources of Energy, held in Kenya.

chaired the conference that launched the Uruguay Round of international trade negotiations in Punta del Este, Uruguay, in 1986.
the IDB concluded negotiations for its Seventh (1989) General Increase in Resources.
Eighth (1994) General Increase in Resources.
whose report “A More Secure World: Our Shared Responsibility” was published in December 2004.
Enrique Iglesias resigned from the IDB in 2005
